trans-unit.source: Overview of Azure Resource Manager templates
trans-unit.target: Overview of Azure Resource Manager templates

trans-unit.source: Azure Resource Manager templates allow you to declaratively specify the Azure IaaS infrastructure in Json language by defining the dependencies between resources.
trans-unit.target: Azure Resource Manager templates allow you to declaratively specify the Azure IaaS infrastructure in Json language by defining the dependencies between resources.

trans-unit.source: For a detailed overview of Azure Resource Manager Templates, please refer to the article below:
trans-unit.target: For a detailed overview of Azure Resource Manager Templates, please refer to the article below:

trans-unit.source: Sample template snippet for VM extensions
trans-unit.target: Sample template snippet for VM extensions

trans-unit.source: Deploying VM extensions as part of an Azure Resource Manager template requires you to declaratively specify the extension configuration in the template.
trans-unit.target: Deploying VM extensions as part of an Azure Resource Manager template requires you to declaratively specify the extension configuration in the template.

trans-unit.source: Here is the format for specifying the extension configuration.
trans-unit.target: Here is the format for specifying the extension configuration.

trans-unit.source: As you can see from the above, the extension template contains two main parts:
trans-unit.target: As you can see from the above, the extension template contains two main parts:

trans-unit.source: Identifying the publisher, type, and typeHandlerVersion for any extension
trans-unit.target: Identifying the publisher, type, and typeHandlerVersion for any extension

trans-unit.source: Azure VM extensions are published by Microsoft and trusted 3rd party publishers and each extension is uniquely identified by its publisher,type and the typeHandlerVersion.
trans-unit.target: Azure VM extensions are published by Microsoft and trusted 3rd party publishers and each extension is uniquely identified by its publisher,type and the typeHandlerVersion.
